title.narrative: ADOLESCENT PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: 4.4 Adolescents in the selected municipalities participate significantly in social oversight processes related to policies and programmes relevant to their integrated development, which contributes to Human Rights Institutions, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2021, the context of social policies is based on a rights-based approach and takes gender differences into account, as well as placing an emphasis on children who suffer exclusion

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.4 Adolescents in the selected municipalities participate significantly in social oversight processes related to policies andprogrammes relevant to their integrated development

description.narrative: Some 3,606 adolescents from public schools developed life skills and competencies in participation and civic engagement, using educational materials developed by UNICEF. The training emphasized the participation of adolescent girls, who represented approximately two thirds of the total number of adolescents trained (2,373). | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2022
